title: The 20 Best School Districts in the U.S.
text:
The 20 Best School Districts in the U.S. Written by: Caroline Nolan 09/19/15 - 11:51 AM EDT 
NEW YORK ( TheStreet ) – While the summer heat hasn’t yet gone away, it is clear that the new academic year has finally arrived. 
However, school districts across the country have been preparing for the 2015-2016 academic year long before stores even announced their back-to-school specials. As a result, many school districts are recognized for their excellent academics and positive school cultures. 
Ranking and review site Niche.com has identified the best school districts in the United States using data sourced from various government and public data sets, the website’s own proprietary data and more than four million opinion-based survey responses across a variety of topics from 287,606 current students, recent alumni and parents. More Headlines The Slow Climb Out of Credit Card Debt 
These surveys were used to grade each school district on factors including Academics, Health & Safety, Student Culture & Diversity, Survey Responses, Teachers, Resources & Facilities, Extracurriculars & Activities and Sports & Fitness. 
Students in New York and Pennsylvania are in luck, as 14 of the top 20 school districts are located in these two states. 
Did the school district in your area make the list? Click through to find out. 
20. Bronxville Union Free School District Bronxville, NY 
Parent/Student Surveys on Overall Experience: 3.9 out of 5 Student Culture & Diversity Grade: C- Resources & Facilities Grade: A+ 
Of the 1,628 students (K-12) in the Bronxville Union Free School District, 68% of students are considered proficient in reading and/or math by New York state standards. Students from this district have received average scores of 660 on Math, 650 on Reading, and 670 Writing on the SATs, and 30 out of 36 on the ACT. 1
